author: dreid
msg: Removing the original apr_ring.h file as this is now in
apr/include so it can be used by both APR and APR_UTIL.
This should have zero effect to apr-util.

author: trawick
msg: fix the name of the shared library for libapr on AIX
once we switched to run-time linking, libtool decided we wanted
to use a .so file instead of an archive

author: trawick
msg: change Apache/apr/apr-util to use run-time linking on AIX
apr-util doesn't have to reference APR's export file

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Okay, back out the libtool dependency stuff.
We need to figure out what AIX can support or not.  Since I don't have
AIX, I have no way of doing any further research, so this needs to be

author: jerenkrantz
msg: If we tell libtool what our link dependencies are (by including them when
we build libaprutil.la), it will remember the dependencies for us.  So, if
a third-party (say httpd, flood, SVN, etc.) want to link against
libaprutil.la, they don't need to worry about the library dependencies that
are currently stored in that mess called export_vars.sh.
(This is essentially the same commit just made to APR.)
